intro: Guettarda excisa, commonly known as the Florida beauty or sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a low-growing, evergreen shrub that typically reaches a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves that are usually dark green and slightly hairy. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are clustered in terminal panicles. Guettarda excisa thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites.
